extends javax.swing.JPanel

This class implements a XY plotter.

Plotter

public Plotter(double[][] dataX,
               double[][] dataY,
               java.lang.String title,
               java.lang.String labelX,
               java.lang.String labelY,
               java.lang.String[] name,
               int[] symbol,
               java.awt.Color[] color,
               boolean xLine,
               boolean yLine,
               boolean uLine,
               boolean rLine,
               boolean pLine,
               boolean hGrid,
               boolean vGrid,
               double xLineX,
               double yLineY,
               java.lang.String regression,
               java.lang.String percentage,
               java.awt.Color[] addedLineColor,
               java.lang.String legendLocation,
               int nHDivi,
               int nVDivi,
               int markLengthX,
               int markLengthY,
               int nTickX,
               int nTickY,
               int tickLengthX,
               int tickLengthY,
               double maxX,
               double minX,
               double maxY,
               double minY,
               java.awt.Font titleFont,
               java.awt.Font labelFont,
               java.awt.Font legendFont,
               java.awt.Font numberFont,
               int topInset,
               int bottomInset,
               int leftInset,
               int rightInset,
               boolean isExpX,
               boolean isExpY,
               boolean isLogX,
               boolean isLogY,
               boolean isHistogram,
               double intervalSize,
               boolean baseline,
               java.lang.String baseLabel,
               int nDigitX,
               int nDigitY,
               javax.swing.JFrame frame,
               int[][] indPoints)
Create a new Plotter JPanel and save information about the data values and the labeling.

Parameters:
dataX - a double[][] containing X data values for a number(dataX.length) of curves
dataY - a double[][] containing Y data values for a number(dataY.length) of curves
title - the title of the data plot
labelX - the label for the x axis.
labelY - the label for the y axis.
name - the name of the curve.
xLine - the flag specifies if a vertical line is required.
yLine - the flag specifies if a horizontal line is required.
uLine - the flag specifies if a unit slope line is required.
rLine - the flag specifies if regression line is required.
pLine - the flag specifies if percentile line is required.
hGrid - the flag specifies if horizontal grid lines are required.
vGrid - the flag specifies if vertical grid lines are required.
xLineX - the X value of which the vertical line intersects the X axis.
yLineY - the Y value of which the horizontal line intersects the Y axis
regression - the name of the selected curve for regression.
percentage - the percentage of the percentiles for the regression.
addedLineColor - the colors of the five added lines in a Color array. Each element represents: "red", "yellow", "orange", "blue", "pink", "magenta", "cyan", "green", "gray", or "black".
symbol - the symbol types of the curves in an int array. Each element represents: "dot", "circle", "filled square", "square", "filled up triangle", "up triangle", "filled down triangle", "down triangle", "cross", "check mark", "thick solid line", "thin solid line", "thin dashed line", "thick dashed line or vertical bar".
color - the colors of the curves in a Color array. Each element represents: "red", "yellow", "orange", "blue", "pink", "magenta", "cyan", "green", "gray", or "black".
legendLocation - the location of the legend: "Inside", "Top", "Right", or null if not showing the legend.
nHDivi - number of horizontal divisions.
nVDivi - number of vertical divisions.
markLengthX - length of division marks on X axis.
markLengthY - length of division marks on Y axis.
nTickX - number of ticks on X axis between adjacent vertical grid.
nTickY - number of ticks on X axis between adjacent horizontal grid.
tickLengthX - length of ticks on X axis.
tickLengthY - length of ticks on Y axis.
maxX - the upper bound of X.
minX - the lower bound of X.
maxY - the upper bound of Y.
minY - the lower bound of Y.
titleFont - the title font.
labelFont - the label font.
legendFont - the legend font.
numberFont - the number font.
topInset - the additional top inset.
bottomInset - the additional bottom inset.
leftInset - the additional left inset.
rightInset - the additional right inset.
isExpX - the flag that specifies if the X numerical lables use exponential expression.
isExpY - the flag that specifies if the Y numerical lables use exponential expression.
isLogX - the flag that specifies if X axis is in log scale.
isLogY - the flag that specifies if Y axis is in log scale.
isHistogram - the flag that specifies if plotting a histogram.
intervalSize - the size of intervals of the histogram.
baseline - the flag that specifies the baseline should be drawn in the histogram.
baseLabel - the label for the baseline of the histogram.
nDigitX - number of digits right to the decimal point of the X numerical lable.
nDigitY - number of digits right to the decimal point of the Y numerical lable.
frame - window of the plot.
indPoints - an array of int arrays each containing number of data points for each individual of a curve, null for not individualized.

paintComponent

public void paintComponent(java.awt.Graphics gc)
Repaint the JPanel with all the desired information. The plot includes x and y axes, data curve,s labels showing the max x and y values, and a title label.

Overrides:
paintComponent in class javax.swing.JComponent

gc - the graphics context provided by the system.

drawSymbol

public void drawSymbol(java.awt.Graphics2D gc2D,
                       int symbolType,
                       int x,
                       int y)
Draw symbols of the plot.

Parameters:
gc2D - the graphics context.
symbolType - the inty value represents the type of the symbol to draw: "dot", "circle", "filled square", "square", "filled up triangle", "up triangle", "filled down triangle", "down triangle", "cross", "check mark", "thick solid line", "thin solid line" or "dashed line".
x - the x center of the symbol location.
y - the y center of the symbol location.

getDefaultRange

public static double[] getDefaultRange(double[][] data,
                                       boolean isLog)
Get the default data range for plotting.

Parameters:
data - a double[][] containing the data.
Returns:
a double array containing minimum value and maximum value of the data in order.

optDivisions

public static double[] optDivisions(int maxSteps,
                                    double min,
                                    double max)
Find the best aoto-sacale among divisors 1, 2 and 5.

Parameters:
maxSteps - Maximum number of steps allowed.
min - Mimimum value.
max - maximum value.
Returns:
A double array containing adjasted min, adjasted max and number of divisions.
